reviews.review_msg: A lot of homework. Grading is tough depending on TA. They expect very specific answers so pay attention to the rubric. i barely made it but super do-able. Pretty strict grading system too.

Her lectures were engaging and fairly entertaining. She gives fair warning for all upcoming assignments with clear instructions. However, the tutorials felt like a waste of time; we were always let out super early and felt like there was nothing to talk about that wasn't said in the lecture already.

Lim's lectures are clear and easy to follow but man are her lectures boring / disengaging. Her TA's can be unreliable and inconsistent with grading, it seems like the prof and TA's are not on the same page. Doesn't seem like she really cares tbh. The TA's do not prepare you for the research paper adequately, so stay on top of it yourself.

Dr. Lim, while an engaging lecturer, is not an understanding professor. She does not provide accommodations regardless of documentation or circumstances on assignments. She can often be blunt and seems to expect her students to work as if they are machines. Her exams are heavily based on the textbook and difficult. Would avoid if possible!

She's a wonderful lecturer and person. The only thing is that she expects the whole textbook to be known, regardless of whether or not she mentioned certain topics in class. Other than that she's wonderful

I liked Diana she was nice but her exam material was tough. You better read the entire textbook front to back to do well on weekly quizzes and midterms. It is not easy with her, you have to work hard and make this class your top priority to keep up w/ weekly quizzes and 3 midterms. She also would not bump me 0.3% to have an A- in her class
lectures went over all the basic concepts from the textbook which was very helpful. responds to emails fast. nice lady. paper was graded pretty tough but depends on your TA

Most boring class ever, you MUST read the textbook and memorize literally all of it or you won't do that good. The average was extremely low. This prof and class isn't anything special, the content isn't too hard but this class just has so much info and it's so boring that it makes it hard. The wording on her exams is also weird.

Pretty straightforward prof, she tells you what she expects out of you and as long as you stick to readings and lectures youll be fine, doesn't try to trick you and was graded on 4 exams and one paper, as well as weekly quizzes. Shes a really nice prof super understanding and open to offer help.

The class material was very easy but she had some ambiguous questions on the exam where either answer are correct and you must choose the best answer which honestly you could argue is subjective. There's three exams and one essay which is graded very tough and I felt the guidelines were not very clear for the essay content. Lots of weekly reading.

Dr. Diana Lim is an amazing prof. I was a little iffy about taking her class cuz to the mixed reviews but she is a really caring teacher. Her lectures cover most of the main ideas but you should read the textbook to get the nitty gritty details. There are weekly quizzes based off the content covered that week and exams are straightforward.

Kind and encourages questions. Exams are very related to the textbook which is where most of your time is spent for the course. Questions on the exam were pretty fair assuming you properly read through the textbook and took notes on the key ideas.

She had engaging lectures that had you interact and brainstorm, which I appreciated. She seemed very passionate about the subjects that were discussed and took the time to answer our questions. Her exams were not very difficult and focuses mainly on the big ideas. She had weekly quizzes, which could give more credit! 

I would definitely take again

not great prof.didn't use a specific word they wanted on an exam and got no marks for the question. the material isn't hard to learn, its the expectation they have that make it impossible to do well even though its intro psyc. quizzes and exams are hard if you dont read EVERY word of the textbook you won't do well. very low class average

Diana was a great prof, no complaints with her in terms of explaining concepts and her lectures were also recorded. Only issue was the significant weight the textbook held on exams and quizzes, so you do have to read it in order to excel (and it is EXTREMELY dry). Other than that, the course is manageable as long as you keep up with readings:)
Very clear criteria and well organized. Exams and quizzes are tough, but is marked fairly. Her lectures cover the overall topics, but encourages us to read the textbook as well.

The professor is decent at best. The lecture covers basic concepts and is hard to sit through at times. Must read/review the whole textbook to get a good grade. The exams/quizzes are doable but made to trick you. The professor is strict and does NOT set up students to succeed. If Psyc 102 is a requirement take it with a different professor.

Great at teaching core concepts for the class, all of the assessments were very fair. The TA's were very nice and helpful, but their marking was surprisingly difficult. On two of my exams, I had the right idea but lost marks because I didn't use certain words. Otherwise solid class.

I think you're missing out if you don't take the course with her. Office hours were helpful, lectures were well organized and weekly quizzes weren't hard. I genuinely want to take another one of her classes.

There are a few things to note when taking her class. If you have tutorial at 8:30am, you have to hand in your research assignments in person, on campus, at 8:30am. She was not clear that we had to pay for iclicker subscription either. Her late penalty is fair and she is easy to talk to, she is just unclear on important course aspects

Since 201 is a 4 credit class it is a lot of work, but manageable if you stay ahead. I liked Dr. Lim as she was helpful, caring and knowledgable. Weekly i-clicker tests weren't too bad, tougher final exam than I thought it was going to be for multiple choice. Good class and prof.

I took 2 of Lim's classes and they are always well organized, canvas is kept up to date and there are no surprises. TAs seem to care. 70% of exam Qs are multiple choice. She does weekly low-stake canvas quizzes that are helpful to self-check how youre doing. Do those consistently and read the weekly chapter (~30 pages) and you'll get a B

Unfair about PSYC201W final proposel data analyis.,however, when I want to do it in TA class, Due to a strike by the school's teaching assistants my turn to collect data from presentations was disrupted. This resulted in me not having time to collect data.Diana Lim still deducted 10 points from me for "not collecting data".
was okay for an introductory course

I had professor Lim twice and she was always super nice to listen to. Her classes were very engaging and she explained all the concepts really well. The only thing that bothered me was the curved grading, since I did really well in the weekly quizzes and exams but ended up with only a B+. Other than that, it was a great class.

Before taking Dianas class I had heard a lot of mixed reviews about her, some of those are correct while others arent. She is a nice and lovely prof who speaks in a gentle tone. The only thing with Diana is that her quizzes/tests are way too difficult for what she teaches. Its doable, however its almost like she wants to see you get tricked.

Had her a 2nd time and I really liked her clarity and care for students with questions. Her lectures highlight the key points in each chapter that's most likely to be tested on, so exams/quizzes are straightforward (also open-book). As long as you understand the lecture content and skim the textbook, you'll be fine.

Dr. Lim is a respectful and kind professor, but everything is rigorously graded by her and the TAs. Difficult to reach as needed, her lecture chapters are only partially covered, and there is not enough material to prepare for the exam, so you have to be willing to teach yourself from the textbook.

I do not recommend taking this course unless you want to earn a C even with endless efforts. Dr. Lim is nice but her and the TAs grading scheme are ridiculous and brutal. The lectures do not cover the chapters thoroughly and there is a lack of relevant and useful information. Therefore, intensive learning from textbooks is advised.

Dr. Lim is wonderful! Her passion shines through in lectures and makes you feel excited about the subject as well. Tests were open-book and mostly based on the textbook so make sure to take good notes. The written assignment was very short and super easy since it was based on your psychology in your personal life.

Did not learn much from this prof, her recorded lectures dont cover the whole chapter. Had to study thoroughly from the textbook and teach myself the course. Her and the TA grade harshly and she will not go out of her way to help you. I ended up with a decent grade, and thats only because the material isnt tough to understand.
Her lectures are what the tests are about. Nothing difficult and easy to approach to. For each exam and quiz just read the textbook and you will be fine.

Probably my favourite professor so far, reading the textbook and attending lectures is all you really need to pass/understand the course, lectures always help clarify important topics in the textbook! Dr. Lim is also helpful at answering questions in class, and there's always polls/activities to do in lectures which is fun
Diana has an amazing passion when talking about the lecture material and reasonable tests from lecture material.

SFU needs better professors. If you enjoy getting a C+ please take Dr. Lim Lectures are confusing, large portion of materials tested are not covered in lectures. spends too much time irrelevant information that is never tested. She also needs better and more informed TA's.

Dr. Lim is by far the worst professor I have ever taken. Her excuse for a ridiculously low class average is "this is normal for a first year 100 level course" what does that even mean? How about quiz us on lecture material and not random stuff never discussed nor found in the text or the lecture.

Decent professor. Content is easy enough and quizzes/tests/exams are quite straight forward. However, despite being a decent professor, this semester's PSYC 102 class had some of the worst TAs I've ever witnessed. Tough graders for a first year class and very unapproachable. Even so, its manageable and still easy to get a good grade.

I loved Dr. Lim. So far she has been my favourite prof at SFU! She is understanding and the content is fair as long as u do the readings and listen to the lectures. It was online and she is understanding of technical difficulties. She goes over questions on the quizzes each week that the class struggles with. Hope to have her as a prof again!
Dr Lim is one of the best profs at SFU and is a QUEEN. Her lectures are not confusing and are easy to follow I would 100% taking a psyc course with her.

Gives great engaging lectures, doesn't require attendance in class and always posts the lecture recordings. She actively seeks out student feedback throughout the semester and changes her lecture style and material based on class needs.

Dr. Lim really wants you to succeed and that's evident. Her lectures are informational and correlate to work from the textbook so I recommend reading the chapter ahead of the lecture so it really sticks. She is an incredible lecturer and I really enjoyed her class. I am planning to take PSYC100 with her the next time she teaches it. 100% recommend!

Loved this class and this professor! Would 100% take any of her other classes. She's fun and makes everything clear. If u like psych already she will make u love it even more. Genuinely nice and easy to understand. She wants the best for u and gives u time to submit quizzes. You will need to read the textbook chapters that go with the lectures.

She's a really great prof and her lectures sum up the textbook but gives good examples and if you like people telling you about the textbook instead of reading she is good for that. Although you should still read the textbook. She's nice and jokes around at times. Overall good time in her class.

She is a gem! If you get to take a class with her you definitely should! Instead of a midterm and a final, we had 3 unit tests every 2-3 chapters. I only watched her lectures and I did amazing in the course. She explains everything so well and keeps it interesting!

Material and concepts are fairly easy to understand but Dr. Lim likes to confuse you. Only after asking her 3 times, she could answer me that in the exam I was supposed to apply the theory that is still relevant in psychology today instead of one that would have suited but is considered historic. Tutorials are a waste of time.

Dr. Lim's lectures are well thought out and she explains concepts and research very well. I would definitely recommend Dr. Lim if you're a psychology major. The course is thorough and reading is an absolute must, grading is also very fair! Dr. Lim is very approachable and nice, she will answer your questions with lots of thought! :)

The course is basically just the textbook. Fortunately for me, I took the course online so I was able to have my notes by my side. Her pre-recorded lectures help validate what you learned from the textbook but are super redundant. Her live lectures are useless because they cover topics that have already been quizzed on

Dr. Lim is nice but she marks way too hard imo. Tests were quite difficult and vague on what would be tested, they did not match the difficulty of the weekly quizzes. The assignment was marked very hard and she basically said it was because we were inexperienced first years. No specific feedback on tests, quizzes, or paper unless you make a meeting

I wish that she released the averages for tests and quizzes, as well as told you what questions you messed up on but that's only possible if you attend office hours-- kinda annoying. The paper is graded pretty harshly compared to the tests but if you read the TB and watch the lectures, you're fine. She is sweet, and talks about her nephew a lot :)

Nice, approachable, and will answer questions. Very textbook heavy and they're paired with 3-8 lecture videos (10-40min/video) per chapter. Some lectures were tedious b/c they cover exactly what's in the TB, but not necessarily the information you'll be tested on. Final paper's hard so get feedback ASAP. Exam's easy if you read.

Dr. Lim a very hands off prof and doesnt seem to care much about teaching since her exams are based solely on the textbook and not lectures. She also implements an extremely difficult grading scale where an 87 average is needed for an A- and a 91 is needed for an A+.

Gives vague, non-answers when asked about assignments/quizzes. Lecture examples are identical to the textbook. If you are still confused and ask for clarification, she just repeats the same example again, giving no new insights. Quizzes are 30% trick questions, designed to trip you up. I had to scour the book for minutia. Textbook taught the class.

Ive done 2 (out of 3) exams and weekly quizzes so far. I read the textbook and take notes before watching the lectures and taking the quizzes. Overall, I recommend this prof. Dianas lectures confirm whats important from the textbook, and her quizzes/tests accurately test my understanding. Do your readings, and you will like this class!
"You're just overthinking it" That is the response to a critique I had for an exam. I have genuinely never had a worse response in my life.
Test and quizes very confusing as she doesn't let students look at which questions they got wrong.

Not clear with grading criteria. Records lectures in separate segments but focuses little attention on the lectures, and a heavy majority on the textbook so much so that tests and quizzes end up being predominantly obscure, specific questions taken directly from the textbook. The course composed of tests and quizzes, which have short durations.

The only way you can get a good grade on the exams is if you memorize every detail from the text book. Exams are ridiculously focused on minor details, so you have to read the textbook as her lectures only cover the basic topics. Grading criteria was also bad, she did not round up so a 70.6 will be a 70 not a 71.

Dr Lims's exams are very deep and heavy. You need to read every single line in the text book and understand the material deeply because she is going to give you scenarios based on the information. Also, she does't want anyone to reach out to her regarding the marks and grades!! she won't respond you
Her teaching is not that bad, but the grade distribution is terrible. Like normally a 86 is an A- but it is B+ in this class, so be aware of it.

nice person but her 14% essay completely ruined some peoples marks. she made It seem very casual and easy but did not mark that way at all. got A's and A+ on all 3 exams and average of 90% on her quizzes but finished with a B+ in the end cuz of her paper marks. use the textbook, it helps more than her lectures and exams based off TB basically

Dr. Lim is a solid professor. She is organized and communicates clearly. Her weekly recorded lectures were broken up into a series of mini lectures posted on a weekly schedule. I personally did not find the weekly live meetings to be of value. I would suggest integrating mini writing assignments to prepare students for the term paper.

Great course for people who don't like writing, there was just one easy 500-800w essay. I found that writing my own notes from the textbook was easier and better for quizzes & exams as her lectures are quite long but not that detailed. I like that she asked for our feedback around midterm time and implemented changes that most of us asked for.

Dr. Diana Lim gives great advice on how to study for her class which I appreciate. However, she does not give great feedback and is a tough marker on papers. Her lectures were also quite useless to me. I actually found the textbook far more helpful when it comes to studying for quizzes and tests. So get prepared to read A LOT.

Overall, Dr. Lim was a great lecturer with clear slides and got straight to the point. The only thing I want to point out is that she is a very tough grader, and removed 15% for each day/hour late, which brings lots of anxiety, especially during a pandemic. I just wish she showed more empathy towards students' circumstances right now.
Dr Lim did an awesome job creating a really well structured online class. She was very approachable and the TA's gave good feedback on written assignments. I would definitely take her class again!
no feedback, useless lectures, long readings, its an intro class
Psyc102 isn't a necessarily hard class. Diana Lim gives good lectures. Very clear with expectations and outlines, with plenty of stuff to grade on to get an overall good grade on.

Dr. Lim was a great prof!! She explains concepts clearly, is open for office hours and uses visuals in lectures videos a lot to cater towards visual learners as well. I would 100% take another class with her again!

Prof Lam is awesome! Her lectures are short and interesting. She explains concepts super clearly. Her canvas modules and organization overall is great. The assignments are very straightforward and each one prepares you for the final essay. The one qualm I had was I wasn't able to find research in the topic I got (Photographic Memory) since 2010.
